<Cog />

# Theme

Control your app's visual appearance with six configuration options. Kookie UI Theme is a fork of [Radix Themes](https://www.radix-ui.com/themes), offering the same foundation with custom enhancements for theming and accessibility.

</Section>

<Section size="1">

## Props

<CodeBlock buttonsPosition="center">

```tsx
import { Theme } from '@kushagradhawan/kookie-ui';
```

</CodeBlock>

<Section size="1">

## Appearance

Set `appearance` to control light, dark, or system preference mode.

<CodeBlock>

```tsx
// Light mode
<Theme appearance="light">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>

// Dark mode
<Theme appearance="dark">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>

// System preference (default)
<Theme appearance="inherit">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>
```

</CodeBlock>

</Section>



<Section size="1">

## Accent Color

Use `accentColor` to set the primary color for interactive elements.

<CodeBlock>

```tsx
// Blue accent (default)
<Theme accentColor="blue">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>

// Crimson accent
<Theme accentColor="crimson">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>

// Other available colors: gray, gold, bronze, brown, yellow, amber, orange, tomato, red, ruby, pink, plum, purple, violet, iris, indigo, cyan, teal, jade, green, grass, lime, mint, sky
```

</CodeBlock>

</Section>



<Section size="1">

## Material

Set `material` to control panel transparency for depth and visual separation.

<CodeBlock>

```tsx
// Solid backgrounds (default)
<Theme material="solid">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>

// Translucent backgrounds for depth effects
<Theme material="translucent">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>
```

</CodeBlock>

</Section>



<Section size="1">

## Gray Color

Use `grayColor` to set the neutral gray scale for backgrounds and text.

<CodeBlock>

```tsx
// Gray scale (default)
<Theme grayColor="gray">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>

// Other available grays: mauve, slate, sage, olive, sand, tomato, red, ruby, pink, plum, purple, violet, iris, indigo, blue, cyan, teal, jade, green, grass, lime, mint, amber, orange, yellow, bronze, gold, brown
```

</CodeBlock>

</Section>

<Section size="1">

## Radius

Set `radius` to control the global corner radius scale for all components.

<CodeBlock>

```tsx
// No radius
<Theme radius="none">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>

// Small radius
<Theme radius="small">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>

// Medium radius (default)
<Theme radius="medium">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>

// Large radius
<Theme radius="large">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>

// Full radius (pill-shaped)
<Theme radius="full">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>
```

</CodeBlock>

</Section>

<Section size="1">

## Scaling

Set `scaling` to control the global size scale for UI density.

<CodeBlock>

```tsx
// Compact UI (90% scale)
<Theme scaling="90%">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>

// Slightly compact (95% scale)
<Theme scaling="95%">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>

// Normal scale (100% - default)
<Theme scaling="100%">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>

// Slightly larger (105% scale)
<Theme scaling="105%">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>

// Large scale (110% scale)
<Theme scaling="110%">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>
```

</CodeBlock>

</Section>

<Section size="1">

## Font Family

Set `fontFamily` to control the typography system for your app.

<CodeBlock>

```tsx
// Sans-serif fonts (default)
<Theme fontFamily="sans">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>

// Monospace fonts
<Theme fontFamily="mono">
  <YourApp />
</Theme>
```

</CodeBlock>

</Section>



<Section size="1">

## Enhancements

Kookie UI extends Radix Themes with practical improvements:

### Material

Use `material` instead of `panelBackground` for intuitive panel transparency control. Existing `panelBackground` usage works with migration warnings. All panels automatically respect your material setting.

### Effects

Extended blur tokens provide 12-step blur scale for precise backdrop effects. Granular opacity offers 9-step opacity scale for fine-tuned transparency. Specialized 3D button effects create realistic depth and elevation.

### Typography

Pre-configured Inter and JetBrains Mono fonts with proper fallbacks prevent browser font weight synthesis issues. Graceful degradation falls back to system fonts if custom fonts fail.

</Section>



<Section size="1">

## Tokens

Use CSS custom properties to access theme values in your styles:

<CodeBlock>

```css
/* Color tokens */
var(--accent-9)           /* Primary accent color */
var(--gray-11)            /* High contrast text */
```

</CodeBlock>

<CodeBlock>

```css
/* Layout tokens */
var(--space-4)            /* Standard spacing */
var(--radius-3)           /* Component border radius */
```

</CodeBlock>

</Section>
